values: Owled Mere to see if I can stay with her during the hols. I sincerely hope I can, as if I can't I'll be, in effect, homeless; I'm not going to stay with them. That would just be asking for trouble, really.
Happy birthday, Kevin. Though I'm sure you will, if he has anything to do with it.

This is in no way directed at you or you, but is there anyone who'd like an eight-month-old cat, fully trained, very lovable, who comes with a much-chewed-upon catnip mouse? Who's, no offense intended, not a Ravenclaw girl?

Hmm. It is, in my mind, slightly odd that a conversation should start off about evil giant squirrels and should end with a suggestion that one of the typers should get a house transfer. Which, if meant to be an offhanded insult, was rather not-insulting.

However. Maybe that's just me trying to confuse myself again, huh?
Congratulations to the Slytherin team. Everyone - everyone, in every house - played great this season. It was quite entertaining to watch. Good job!
Reason about the fortieth why big sisters rule - they send you owls with coffee attached.
Hey. It's April. What an idea.
Many happy birthday wishes to you. You didn't wake up this morning as a different person, did you?
Does anyone have a spare quill, pen, pencil, or stub of graphite I can use until one of mine resurfaces? I'd be forever indebted; I think I'm slightly too anaemic to use blood.
Su! Wow, I can't believe even you're here now. I was hoping you wouldn't be coerced... now all my hopes have been dashed!

Tessa wandered back a few minutes ago. She was completely nonchalant, except that she was mewing at me, apparently for her dinner. She's now brawling with the mouse-catnip toy you gave her. She loves it, by the way. I just hope she's not pregnant, if such a thing is possible.

I think Tessa wandered off a few days ago. Sometimes I won't see her for a few days, but the food gets eaten, so I don't worry... but I put food out yesterday morning and it still hasn't been eaten.

If anyone sees her... let me know?

I think I've managed to finish that essay. I'll probably get a less-than-spectacular mark on it, though. Oh well. Good luck tomorrow, team! You'll win, I know it. ...and now I'm quite bored again. Humph. At least the essay was something to do.

Well, I've been rather bored lately. I seem to have had a topic for that horrid HoM essay, and I started writing it, but now I seem to have lost what the topic was. ...and yes, I realize that it's unbelievably sad that I can't figure it out from what I have written of my essay so far.

No more broken bones.

Hmm... don't fall for stupid tricks.

Don't fall for girls I can't hold on to.

Be more sociable.

Try to kick the coffee thing.

Stop being so gloomy.

<lj-cut text="Padma">
Hand-delivered, so the card was lost to the world.
Present: About 3 dozen cookies and a pair of dangly porcelain pumpkin earrings.</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="Parvati">
Parvati-
Good friend, you are. ...can you tell my brother-in-law's rubbing off on me? Merry Christmas!
-Sophie
Present: A pair of hair sticks with dark blue stones on the tops, and instructions on how to use them.</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="Meredith">
Mere-
Where would we be without sisters to shelter and thwap us simultaneously? Nowhere! Love ya, big sister.
-Sophie
Present: A teddy bear charmed to sing and dance - for when she just *needs* a break - and the Encyclopaedia Britannica, I and J. [Yes, Mere has the ones preceding it.]</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="Robert">
Robert-
I'm still glad you married my sister, even though your sci-fi speak is starting to rub off on me, I swear! Merry Christmas!
-Sophie
Present: A little make-your-own-world kit. Comes with a map, instructions, and lots of charmed moulding compound.</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="Poly">
She's not even close to reading yet, so Sophie attempted to draw a brightly colored Christmas tree. It ended up looking like a multicolored triangle upended on a brown stump, but she tried.
Present: A sparkly dolly that'll do the hokey-pokey if it's poked enough.</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="Charlie">
Charlie-
I still say you're the resident Knight in Shining Armor for Hogwarts, but even Shining-Armored Knights get cold sometimes. Merry Christmas!
Present: A multicolored scarf with tassels on each end and little silver bells sewn into it, so people can hear him a mile away!</lj-cut>

All my presents are wrapped, the ones I had to are sent, and I'm actually quite at peace. I guess holidays do that to you.

Also, on a completely random note, proving that I notice things far later than everyone else, what is with all the mistletoe in the Common Room lately? It's everywhere.
I've just realized that I've got maybe five days until Christmas and I only know what I'm getting one person. And that's just a maybe. So, yeah. I feel really dumb, right now. And rather rushed.

My nose was still pokey-sore when I went to bed last night. Humph. Y'know, if you don't tell me what you'd like on your pumpkin, you're going to get a hollowed-out one with an extremely depressed look on its face and a bunch of cookies, which may or may not be burnt. So there.

By the way, I still resent what you said yesterday. I can be plenty happy. Hee. See? Besides, watching a kitten play with a piece of ribbon would make anyone happy. ...I think Mere put something into these cookies she sent me. Really. I'm feeling rather silly at the moment.

[[The writing is small, and there are some blotches where words have been crossed out. The ribbon around it is deep red.]]

Padma--

<strike>You're not</strike>

<strike>If I hadn't</strike>

<strike>The last thing I w</strike>

Oh, fuck it. I think I'll be able to get this out better if I really have to say it, instead of writing it, so do you think we could talk sometime? 

I like the owl you chose. Majestic.

Sophie

P.S. I'll save you, if you'll let me.

I've been thinking, and I've decided that there's really no reason to be so frightened of my dreams, as they may be rather disturbing but since they're simply waste products of my imagination, running on, um, screen saver, so to speak, there's nothing I should be worried about. 

(And, completely destroying my facade of eloquence and somewhat gracefulness, I would just like to note that I really do not believe any of the above paragraph. However, it does make me feel slightly better to state such things.)

I've also decided that it's not quite the best idea to live on coffee and three hours of sleep for every two days I'm awake, as it lets my subconscious do sneaky things which, under any other circumstances, I would not allow it to do, and am determined to get a full night's sleep tonight. I should be awake for the game, after all.
I guess I just knocked it against something, but the pain is gone. Huh.

Thank you for the advice you gave me last night. And hey, it's always good when you talk someone out of passing out, right? Hermione, I think all my notes are fully readable. If they aren't, and they might not be, just let me know. I'll come translate. I have decided that my subconscious is a sneaky little bugger, which rather has it in for me.

[[The letter is dropped on Padma's bed after everyone has left for breakfast, so anyone who went into the dorms after that and before she picked it up would've seen it. It's tied with a blue ribbon, and the handwriting is jagged. The ink has run in some places where water seems to have fallen on it.]] Padma-- I'm sorry we didn't make it to Eeylops this weekend. I would've gone with you, but... we seem to have gotten very good at avoiding each other these past few weeks, I suppose. I just... I wanted to say that I'm sorry. For all the hell I put you through. I really haven't an excuse, to be hones, the Best thing I can say is that I was... under a spell. (By the way, Charlie Weasley is the resident Knight in Shining Armor for Hogwarts. He can even carry a damsel in distress back to her home.) I know what I did was mean. It was horrible. It was all the things I grew up wanting not to be. If God were to give me another favor in life (the first of which was being able to spend any time with you at all), it would be to undo it. There's not a thing I regret more. I still love you, Padma. With all my everything. We're... we're but a few steps away from one another, during the day, but those few steps become a gaping chasm, ready to swallow me into the earth, chew me up, and spit me out. And I know I'm a damned fool, and a coward, for not risking it. But... hey, if I'm going to embarrass myself in front of the person whose opinion matters most to me, I might as well do it looking my best, right? Right. I realize that in writing this, I've just destroyed any lingering possibilities there may have been for us to be more than just passing acquaintances, girls who see each other every day but never really got to know one another. For that, I sincerely apologize. Please understand, though, you had to know this. I had to tell you. You were my everything, my love, my true happiness. You were the light that never went dark, even in stormy times such as these. I was head over heels for you. I still am. All my undying love Sophie

Look at me, updating before noon. Amazing.

<lj user="ellie_b">, I told you. You did help. Really!

I'm feeling rather unhealthily chipper this morning. I don't know why, other than the fact that I actually let myself sleep for a few hours last night. I didn't scare myself awake, or wake up crying, which I take to be a good sign.

Well, I talked to Padma earlier today. In person. And yawned, anything but gracefully. Speaking of that, I really should go get some coffee. But anyway, we talked. And yeah. Was much with the awkwardness.

Actually, upon reflection, I probably should sleep if I'm going out tomorrow. However, I'm afraid that I'll wake up less rested than when I fell asleep, considering the trend of dreams I've had lately.

This is so very odd. It almost feels like I've... but I know I haven't done anything to it. I'm sure. It'd be rather dumb to have it completely healed up and then knock it against something and have half of the healing undone.

But I've not knocked it against anything.

Apparently, not only was sitting out in the cold and falling asleep a bad idea, but it was a bad idea that waited to make itself known. Ow. 

Ow.

And Mere didn't give me any of that ache stuff because she said she doesn't want me to get tolerant to it, whatever that means. It should go away, soon. If it hasn't by tomorrow, though, I think I'm going to go see if I can get something for it.

If it's even remotely possible to fix the damage I've done, I am definitely sure I'm going to at least try. Just... try not to make it more than it really is. Don't shock her, don't scare her, don't do anything at all that could mess this up. There's no bloody way I'm going to let myself mess this up.

[[A little grey owl drops the parchment, tied with a piece of ribbon that matches it. The writing is far too neat, like the writer had to consciously stop herself and go slower.]]

Padma--

<strike>Of cou</strike> I'd be glad to come with you. Just tell me when!

Sophie

No. It can't have meant anything. ...but the one with Allen did. ..no. No. I'll just forget it. ...

Damn. That's it. That's really it. I'm never sleeping again. I mean it this time. I'll live off coffee for the rest of my life. And then when I do sleep, it'll be restful, and dream-free. Thank the Lord.

...who do you talk to when the person to whom you'd normally talk is the person about whom you need to talk?
Hermione, sorry I was so short yesterday. I was rather elsewhere right then, but I am sorry.

The Astronomy Tower isn't even all that comfortable, really. But at least it's not snowed yet. If it had, I'd be an icicle right now, stuck to a turret. 

I've done all my homework, I think. So I think I'm going to go be a hermit again. If anyone feels like trying to make me be social again, they're welcome to try, though.

Well, I'm back, if anyone wanted to know. And I'll be staying here for all the hols, till summer. 

Why is it that I knew what I was doing was right, I was sure of it, and then he started talking and I wasn't so sure? I did what I set out to do, but I did so with much regret... and now I'm getting that headache back. 

As long as it's light out, which it might not be for very much longer, I'm going up to the top of the Astronomy Tower, and I think I'm going to try to write some more. My poor book has been completely forgotten. Sad.

Oh, and by the way, congratulations to the Ravenclaw Quidditch team. We may not've won this game, but we're still far in the overall lead. Yay.

I think I'll be back at school sometime this evening. All my stuff is taken care of, but Mere wants me to stay for dinner. And since she's letting me store my stuff in her attic, besides the fact that she's my favorite sibling, of course I said yes.

Also, for anyone who's ever had a headache and couldn't get rid of it, Muggle... umm... asperin, I think it's called, is a wonderful thing. Got rid of mine in about a quarter of an hour. 

Also, Muggle radio stations are extremely odd. They play American country back-to-back with rap.

Armed with a better view of the world, some righteous anger, and some protection spells [thank you again a thousand times, sir], I'm going to visit my parents again this weekend. If all goes well, I should be back tomorrow evening. Mere said I could stay with her whenever, but I really don't want to cause a lot of trouble. She's got a baby, after all. If I come back and I've forgotten anything at all about this past week, please go get someone of authority.
Professor Lupin, thank you an unlimited amount of times for the book. I promise I will get it back to you tomorrow, as soon as possible. And... thank you for not asking further.

I... first of all, I really, sincerely, apologize to the professors who teach the classes I took yesterday and today. If I seemed... away, I am truly sorry, and I promise I will get the notes/work/whatever I missed. I've realized, yesterday and today, how much of an idiot I'd been my whole life. Just... letting the dreams and the misplaced sounds haunt me... accepting that it was just part of the defection that was me. And I don't even know why I told you... I'm glad I did, though. After I talk with Professor Dumbledore, I think I'll have to go visit him again. Before I do, though, I think I should look up some shielding spells, if such a thing exists. Does anyone know if they do, and if so, which ones are good to protect against mind-altering charms? It'd be much appreciate it. ...this didn't come out exactly the way I thought it would, but I suppose it's quite close, anyway.

Charlie? I was mad at you earlier, but now.. Thank you. Really. Knight in shining armor, indeed. Mandy and Lisa, I'm staying at school for the hols. Definitely. Well, I know why Mere hates my father so much. No. I'm not going to start ranting. I'm not. I'm not going to start badmouthing my bastard of a father where he can't even see me. He may not be worth insulting to his face, but I just want to hear what his paltry excuses will be.

I think I've decided to just give up sleep and live on coffee the rest of my life. Because sleep? Just not working. 

I'll be up on the Astronomy Tower watching the sky if anyone needs me.

Yeah, I didn't sleep very well last night, as anyone who was downstairs in the Common Room in the middle of the night noticed. It's like I hardly slept at all. Which might be true, as I kept waking up in the middle of the night. Crying. And I've no clue at all what I was dreaming about that made me so upset.

And no, I didn't figure anything out, Charlie.

Dreams don't mean anything. Right. They're just the mind running off the extra stuff you've got in your mind. Right. 

Just keep repeating that to yourself, Sophie. If you do it'll come true.

Hey Charlie! We still haven't finished that chess game, if ever you want me to stop by so we can. ... Charlie, we've never played chess. Why do I seem to think we have, even though I know for a fact we haven't?
I finally went through all the entries I missed... don't know why I didn't before. The entries just further back my claim that there's a school-wide joke on me. Oh well.

I can't believe I didn't say this before!

<marquee>CONGRATULATIONS <lj user="r_weasley"> AND <lj user="finchfletchly">!!!</marquee>

Well, I suppose a post about my weekend is in order, so here goes. I got home on Friday, and by that time I was both tired and hungry, so I had a snack and went to sleep. Go me. On Saturday, since the entire house woke up rather late, we went out to brunch at some restaurant, I can't remember the name. Then we got back, and they wanted to know how I was, and what had happened since the beginning of the year. I told them, but selectively edited so they wouldn't get worried and transfer me. They were both sad when I told them what had happened with Padma, but Dad said, and Mum agreed, that it was the best thing to do. I saw Mere on Sunday!! She only came over for about an hour, during which Dad made himself scarce by cleaning in the kitchen, but it was really nice to see her anyway. And she brought Poly, and I have to say that I have the most adorable niece ever. She even smiled and gurgled at me a few times!

[[Tied with a pale yellow ribbon. The writing is just a bit shaky. Attached is an envelope containing a slip of paper from Eeylops Owl Emporium.]]

Padma--

I'm extremely sorry that I didn't send this to you on your actual birthday, though it's only to be expected of a dolt like I am. I hope you'll accept the gift anyway.

Well, I know that you and Parvati sent the owl you were sharing back home, and you were planning on waiting till Christmas to get a new one. Use the school owls till then. But I figured you shouldn't need to wait that long. You're worth it, anyway.

If you take the slip of paper to the main desk at Eeylops, the person there will look at it for a moment, then tell you to pick an owl out. Any owl. Pick one you like. I've been in there, and there were some fairly nice ones.

Happy happy belated birthday. Enjoy your seventeenth year.

Sophie

[[Tied up with a blue ribbon. Attached is a stiff envelope containing a gift certificate to Flourish and Blotts.]]

Parvati--

I'm so sorry I didn't send this on your birthday! I've been a bit distracted lately, and I really hope you forgive me!!

Anyway, happy happy happy belated birthday. I hope you enjoy being sixteen!

--Sophie
